ygData.subject: RE: Lava swimming vs dieing  was Bard vs Wizard race?
ygData.msgSnippet: I died my first time in Sol-A - fell off the ramp going up to the zone and died in the lava.  How you guys can swim in ot is beyond me - and I was badly beaten
ygData.messageBody:
I died my first time in Sol-A - fell off the ramp going up to the zone and
died in the lava. How you guys can swim in ot is beyond me - and I was
badly beaten up at he time.

My fiends were able to levitate over the lava and get a loc on me. They
clicked and corpsed and eventually were able to pull me out.

As far as GM's getting you out, sometime they will and sometimes they wont.
One friend lost all her stuff (lots of crafted too) - dunno if she could
have/should have just gotten another GM.

Sylly Songsynger
Bard of the 30th song
<Spirit of the Moon>
somewhere on Innoruuk


-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Monday, October 04, 1999 6:22 PM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard vs Wizard race?

From: <kim@...>

On Mon, 4 Oct 1999 jhenders@... wrote:
>
> That said I'm still glad the time I lost my corpse to a
fire giant
> summoning me that the GM considered it a bug and summoned
my corpse to
> the zone. He said it was under a ledge somewhere in the
lava where I
> never would have got it out.

Yeah, I tried to help some cleric who'd lost his corpse in
the
lava in Sol A. He was even trusting enough to /consent to
me.
My song pointed me down a lava ledge and I couldn't see a
way
out (past the little "window" that looks into lava at the
top
of the curved stairs near the entrance to Sol A). I assume
it
leads to Sol B, but being one-way there was no way I could
drag his corpse back to him. Eventually a GM got his corpse
for him.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
